patches¶

filters¶

A module to filter patches in a slide.

exception Error¶

Bases: Exception

Base of custom errors.

exception UnknownMethodError¶

Bases: pathaia.patches.filters.Error

Raise when no class is found in a datafolder.

filter_has_significant_dapi(image, dapi_channel=0, tolerance=0.5, dapi_tolerance=1)¶

Give if > 50% of dapi in a patch.

Parameters

  • image (-) – image of a patch.

  • dapi_channel (-) – int, channel to extract dapi signal.

  • tolerance (-) – int, value on dapi intensity encountered to accept a patch.

Returns

bool, whether dapi is visible in slide.

Return type

  • has_dapi

filter_has_tissue_he(image, blacktol=5, whitetol=90)¶

Return true if tissue inside the patch.

This version operates in the lab space, conversion of the image from rgb to lab is performed first.

Parameters

  • image (-) – numpy ndarray, rgb image.

  • blacktol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for black pixels.

  • whitetol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for white pixels.

Returns

bool, true if tissue is detected.

Return type

  • has_tissue

filter_hasdapi(image, dapi_channel=0, tolerance=1)¶

Give presence of dapi in a patch.

Parameters

  • image (-) – image of a patch.

  • dapi_channel (-) – int, channel to extract dapi signal.

  • tolerance (-) – int, value on dapi intensity encountered to accept a patch.

Returns

bool, whether dapi is visible in slide.

Return type

  • has_dapi

get_tissue(image, blacktol=5, whitetol=90, method='lab')¶

Return the tissue mask segmentation of an image.

One can choose the segmentation method.

Parameters

  • image (-) – numpy ndarray, rgb image.

  • blacktol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for black pixels.

  • whitetol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for white pixels.

  • method (-) – str, one of ‘lab’ or ‘rgb’, function to be called.

Returns

true pixels are tissue, false are background.

Return type

  • binarymask

get_tissue_from_lab(image, blacktol=5, whitetol=90)¶

Return the tissue mask segmentation of an image.

This version operates in the lab space, conversion of the image from rgb to lab is performed first.

Parameters

  • image (-) – numpy ndarray, rgb image.

  • blacktol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for black pixels.

  • whitetol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for white pixels.

Returns

true pixels are tissue, false are background.

Return type

  • binarymask

get_tissue_from_rgb(image, blacktol=0, whitetol=230)¶

Return the tissue mask segmentation of an image.

True pixels for the tissue, false pixels for the background.

Parameters

  • image (-) – numpy ndarray, rgb image.

  • blacktol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for black pixels.

  • whitetol (-) – float or int, tolerance value for white pixels.

Returns

true pixels are tissue, false are background.

Return type

  • binarymask

standardize_filters(filters, top_level, low_level)¶

Check validity of hierarchical filters.

functional_api¶

A module to extract patches in a slide.

Enable filtering on tissue surface ratio. Draft for hierarchical patch extraction and representation is proposed.

exception Error¶

Bases: Exception

Base of custom errors.

exception UnknownMethodError¶

Bases: pathaia.patches.functional_api.Error

Raise when no class is found in a datafolder.

filter_image(image, filters)¶

Check multiple filters on an image.

Parameters

  • image (-) – numpy array, patch to filter.

  • filters (-) – list of functions, image to bool.

Returns

bool, whether an image has passed every filters.

Return type

  • acceptable

patchify_folder(infolder, outfolder, level, psize, interval, offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters=[], verbose=2)¶

Save patches of all wsi inside a folder.

Parameters

  • slidefile (-) – str, abs path to slide file.

  • outdir (-) – str, abs path to an output folder.

  • level (-) – int, pyramid level.

  • psize (-) – int

  • interval (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} interval between 2 neighboring patches.

  • offset (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} offset in px on x and y axis for patch start.

  • coords (-) – bool, coordinates of patches will be yielded if set to True.

  • tissue (-) – bool, whether to filter on tissue.

  • verbose (-) – 0 => nada, 1 => patchifying parameters, 2 => start-end of processes, thumbnail export.

patchify_folder_hierarchically(infolder, outfolder, top_level, low_level, psize, interval, offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters={}, silent=[], verbose=2)¶

Save hierarchical patches of all wsi inside a folder.

Parameters

  • slidefile (-) – str, abs path to slide file.

  • outdir (-) – str, abs path to an output folder.

  • level (-) – int, pyramid level.

  • psize (-) – int

  • interval (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} interval between 2 neighboring patches.

  • offset (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} offset in px on x and y axis for patch start.

  • coords (-) – bool, coordinates of patches will be yielded if set to True.

  • tissue (-) – bool, whether to filter on tissue.

  • verbose (-) – 0 => nada, 1 => patchifying parameters, 2 => start-end of processes, thumbnail export.

patchify_slide(slidefile, outdir, level, psize, interval, offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters=[], verbose=2)¶

Save patches of a given wsi.

Parameters

  • slidefile (-) – str, abs path to slide file.

  • outdir (-) – str, abs path to an output folder.

  • level (-) – int, pyramid level.

  • psize (-) – int

  • interval (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} interval between 2 neighboring patches.

  • offset (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} offset in px on x and y axis for patch start.

  • coords (-) – bool, coordinates of patches will be yielded if set to True.

  • tissue (-) – bool, whether to filter on tissue.

  • verbose (-) – 0 => nada, 1 => patchifying parameters, 2 => start-end of processes, thumbnail export.

patchify_slide_hierarchically(slidefile, outdir, top_level, low_level, psize, interval, offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters={}, silent=[], verbose=2)¶

Save patches of a given wsi in a hierarchical way.

Parameters

  • slidefile (-) – str, abs path to slide file.

  • outdir (-) – str, abs path to an output folder.

  • level (-) – int, pyramid level.

  • psize (-) – int

  • interval (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} interval between 2 neighboring patches.

  • offset (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} offset in px on x and y axis for patch start.

  • coords (-) – bool, coordinates of patches will be yielded if set to True.

  • tissue (-) – bool, whether to filter on tissue.

  • verbose (-) – 0 => nada, 1 => patchifying parameters, 2 => start-end of processes, thumbnail export.

slide_rois(slide, level, psize, interval, ancestors=[], offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters=[])¶

Return the absolute coordinates of patches.

Given a slide, a pyramid level, a patchsize in pixels, an interval in pixels and an offset in pixels.

Parameters

  • slide (-) – openslide object.

  • level (-) – int, pyramid level.

  • psize (-) – int

  • interval (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} interval between 2 neighboring patches.

  • offset (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} offset in px on x and y axis for patch start.

  • coords (-) – bool, coordinates of patches will be yielded if set to True.

Yields

- image – numpy array rgb image. - coords: tuple of numpy arrays, (icoords, jcoords).

object_api¶

A module to extract patches in a slide.

Enable filtering on tissue surface ratio. Draft for hierarchical patch extraction and representation is proposed.

exception Error¶

Bases: Exception

Base of custom errors.

class HierarchicalPatchifier(outdir, top_level, low_level, psize, interval, offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters={}, silent=[], verbose=2)¶

Bases: object

A class to handle patchification tasks.

add_filter(filter_func, level=None)¶

Add a filter function to the hierarchical patch extractor.

Parameters

filter_func (-) – callable, a function that take an image as argument and output a bool.

patchify(path)¶

Patchify hierarchically a slide or an entire folder.

Parameters

path (-) – str, absolute path to a slide or a folder of slides.

class Patchifier(outdir, level, psize, interval, offset={'x': 0, 'y': 0}, filters=[], verbose=2)¶

Bases: object

A class to handle patchification tasks.

add_filter(filter_func)¶

Add a filter function to this patch extractor.

Parameters

filter_func (-) – callable, a function that take an image as argument and output a bool.

patchify(path)¶

Patchify a slide or an entire folder.

Parameters

path (-) – str, absolute path to a slide or a folder of slides.

util¶

Useful functions for patch extraction in slides and images.

iter_patches(slide, rois)¶

Iterate on patches, from locations.

Parameters

  • slide (-) – openslide object

  • rois (-) – postion queries

Yields

- query – position - patch: rgb image

list_patches(slide, rois)¶

Put patches in a list, from their location.

Parameters

  • slide (-) – openslide object

  • rois (-) – position queries

Yields

- queries – list of positions - patches: list of images

regular_grid(shape, step)¶

Get a regular grid of position on a slide given its dimensions.

Parameters

  • shape (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} shape of the window to tile.

  • step (-) – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} steps between patch samples.

Yields

- positions – dictionary, {“x”, “y”} positions on a regular grid.

slide_basename(slidepath)¶

Get basename of a slide from the path.

Parameters

slidepath (-) – str, path to a slide file

Returns

str, base name of the slide

Return type

  • basename

slide_get_basename(slide)¶

Get basename of a slide from the slide object.

Parameters

slide (-) – an openslide object

Returns

str, base name of the slide

Return type

  • basename

slides_in_folder(folder, slide_type='.mrxs')¶

Get all slide paths inside a folder.

Parameters

folder (-) – str, path to a directory containing slides

Returns

list of str, list of files

Return type

  • paths

unlabeled_regular_grid(shape, step)¶

Get a regular grid of position on a slide given its dimensions.

Parameters

  • shape (-) – tuple, (i, j) shape of the window to tile.

  • step (-) – int, steps between patch samples.

Yields

- positions – tuples, (i, j) positions on a regular grid.

unlabeled_regular_grid_list(shape, step)¶

Get a regular grid of position on a slide given its dimensions.

Parameters

  • shape (-) – tuple, (i, j) shape of the window to tile.

  • step (-) – int, steps between patch samples.

Yields

- positions – tuples, (i, j) positions on a regular grid.

visu¶

Useful functions for visualizing patches in WSIs.

preview_from_queries(slide, queries, level_preview=7, color=[255, 255, 0], thickness=3)¶

Give thumbnail with patches displayed.

Parameters

  • slide (-) – openslide object

  • queries (-) – patch queries {“x”, “y”, “dx”, “dy”, “level”}

  • level_preview (-) – int, pyramid level for preview thumbnail

  • color (-) – list of int, rgb color for patch boundaries

  • thickness (-) – int, thickness of patch boundaries

Returns

thumbnail image with patches displayed.

Return type

  • thumbnail
